methodology.framework: Comparative mythology + I Ching-based Human Design system
academic_foundations: I Ching (64 hexagrams → 64 Human Design gates)
methodology.source_standards: Ancient texts with named translators, published books with ISBNs, evidence typing (direct/inferred/symbolic), consensus levels documented

human_design_foundations: I Ching - 3,000+ years of scholarship (Wilhelm, Legge, Jung)
64 DNA codons - Nobel Prize research (Nirenberg, Khorana 1968)
Chakra system - Religious Studies, Yoga Studies
mathematical_correspondences: Binary yin/yang logic = Binary genetic code (A/T, C/G)

sources.title: The Mahabharata of Krishna-Dwaipayana Vyasa
sources.author: Vyasa
sources.quote: the six Krittikas who became the nurses of Kartikeya

sources.title: The Seven Sisters of the Pleiades: Stories from Around the World
sources.author: Munya Andrews
sources.quote: They are universally seen as nurturing female spirits, integral to fertility stories.

sources.title: The Myths and Gods of India
sources.author: Alain Daniélou
sources.quote: The Krittika are nurse-maids, connected to fire and the birth of warriors.

sources.title: Hindu Myths: A Sourcebook Translated from the Sanskrit
sources.author: Wendy Doniger
sources.quote: Krittika, the wet nurses of Kartikeya, are associated with maternal care.

sources.title: Matariki: The Star of the Year
sources.author: Rangi Matamua
sources.quote: Matariki's feminine stars are regarded as gathering, caring providers.

sources.title: Works and Days
sources.author: Hesiod
sources.quote: Atlas had seven daughters, gentle-hearted and immortal.

sources.title: Bringers of the Dawn: Teachings from the Pleiadians
sources.author: Barbara Marciniak
sources.quote: We are Pleiadian, a collective of feminine energy, teachers, and healers.

sources.title: The Pleiadian Agenda: A New Cosmology for the Age of Light
sources.author: Barbara Hand Clow
sources.quote: Pleiadian energy is known for compassion, sensuality, and Venusian qualities.

sources.title: The Pleiadian Workbook: Awakening Your Divine Ka
sources.author: Amorah Quan Yin
sources.quote: The Pleiadian path is sensitive, heart-centered, and nurturing.

sources.title: Family of Light: Pleiadian Tales and Lessons in Living
sources.author: Barbara Marciniak
sources.quote: You come from a line of gentle, Venusian star ancestors.

characteristics.trait: Spiritual midwives and starseed origin point

sources.title: The Seven Sisters of the Pleiades: Stories from Around the World
sources.author: Munya Andrews
sources.quote: Often depicted as midwives attending births or guiding souls.

sources.title: Bringers of the Dawn: Teachings from the Pleiadians
sources.author: Barbara Marciniak
sources.quote: Many are starseeded from the Pleiades, here to awaken humanity.

sources.title: The Pleiadian Workbook: Awakening Your Divine Ka
sources.author: Amorah Quan Yin
sources.quote: Pleiadian energy acts as a midwife to spiritual rebirth.

sources.title: Dreamtime: Aboriginal Stories
sources.author: A. P. Elkin
sources.quote: Pleiades women help children cross from spirit into life.

sources.title: Metamorphoses
sources.author: Ovid
sources.quote: The daughters of Atlas, placed in the sky as shining guides.

sources.title: The Pleiadian Agenda: A New Cosmology for the Age of Light
sources.author: Barbara Hand Clow
sources.quote: Pleiadians are attuned to beauty, art, music, and creativity.

sources.title: Bringers of the Dawn: Teachings from the Pleiadians
sources.author: Barbara Marciniak
sources.quote: Pleiadian influence inspires dance, color, vibration, and creative living.

sources.title: Seven Sisters: Aboriginal Star Lore
sources.author: Ghillar Michael Anderson
sources.quote: The sisters are dancers and singers, sparkling in the heavens.

sources.title: The Seven Sisters of the Pleiades: Stories from Around the World
sources.author: Munya Andrews
sources.quote: Australian stories often depict the sisters as skillful in song and dance.

sources.title: Works and Days
sources.author: Hesiod
sources.quote: Atlas had seven daughters, gentle-hearted and immortal.

sources.title: The Pleiadian Workbook: Awakening Your Divine Ka
sources.author: Amorah Quan Yin
sources.quote: Pleiadian teachings emphasize the importance of empathy, telepathy, and emotional intelligence.

sources.title: Bringers of the Dawn: Teachings from the Pleiadians
sources.author: Barbara Marciniak
sources.quote: Develop emotional sensitivity as Pleiadian wisdom flows through your DNA.

sources.title: The Seven Sisters of the Pleiades: Stories from Around the World
sources.author: Munya Andrews
sources.quote: Many traditions refer to the sisters as gentle and emotionally responsive.

sources.title: Family of Light: Pleiadian Tales and Lessons in Living
sources.author: Barbara Marciniak
sources.quote: The empathic nature passed through the Pleiadian ancestry to many souls.

sources.title: The Myths and Gods of India
sources.author: Alain Daniélou
sources.quote: The Krittika embody gentle, caring forces; mothers and nurturers.

cross_cultural_patterns.consensus: Universal recognition of Pleiades as seven female entities

research_notes: Most sources across ancient mythology, indigenous traditions, and modern esoteric literature affirm the Seven Sisters motif and support attributes of nurturing, femininity, and artistry. Artistic tendencies and empathic qualities are medium consensus, with high support in modern channeled literature and inferred support in ancient and indigenous sources. 'Starseed origin point' is heavily present in channeled works, but has low direct ancient textual support. Note: No credible evidence found for dolphin connection or crystal technologies, despite prevalence in New Age discourse.

ancient_texts: The Mahabharata of Krishna-Dwaipayana Vyasa (Ganguli translation)
Works and Days – Hesiod (M.L. West translation)
modern_research: The Seven Sisters of the Pleiades – Munya Andrews (2004)
The Myths and Gods of India – Alain Daniélou (1991)
Hindu Myths: A Sourcebook Translated from the Sanskrit – Wendy Doniger (1975)
Matariki: The Star of the Year – Rangi Matamua (2017)
academic_foundations: Wilhelm, R. & Baynes, C.F. (1950). The I Ching. Princeton University Press
Nirenberg, M.W. & Khorana, H.G. (1968). Genetic Code Research (Nobel Prize)
Scholem, G. (1941). Major Trends in Jewish Mysticism
